Navigator 4.5, Manual Access Platform, 2.5 m platform
Description:
The Navigator 4.5 manual access platform is a safe, efficient, and emission-free push-around scissor lift designed for effortless indoor use, including on mezzanines. Its lightweight construction ensures easy manoeuvrability, while the manual lift mechanism, operated by a simple hand crank, allows continuous operation without the downtime required for battery charging. With no hydraulics, this Navigator 4.5 is the perfect solution for clean and enclosed environments, making it an ideal choice for maintenance, construction, and facility management tasks. Key Features:

  • Fits through standard doorways and can travel in passenger lifts

  • No battery or power source required

  • Anti-surf brakes

  • Anti-climb guardrails

  • Gravity-sensing locking gates

  • Integrated tool tray

Hire the Navigator 4.5m manual access platform and experience simple, hassle-free equipment hire from The Hireman. Discover more of our tools and equipment available for hire today.

Name: PASMA Towers for Users
Short description:
Course aims Mobile access towers are a common sight across the construction industry. PASMA Towers for Users will equip delegates with specialist knowledge on how to work safely with mobile access towers. Delegates on the course will learn:
  • How to safely assemble, dismantle, alter and move mobile access towers
  • The safe use mobile access towers
  • How to inspect mobile access towers
  • The hazards relating to access tower use
  • The legislation, regulations and guidance that are applicable to these towers
This course is designed for operatives and if you’re new to towers or tower training, Towers for Users is the ideal starter course. This course complies with EN 1004. PASMA Training certificate A PASMA Photo Card and certificate will be issued to successful delegates. The certificate is valid for 5 years. Lost Photo Cards can be replaced at a cost. What is covered? Through a combination of theory and practical at work, delegates will learn about:
  • Work at height responsibilities of employers, employees and suppliers
  • Standards affecting the manufacture and use of mobile access towers
  • Where to find crucial safety information
  • When it’s safe to use a mobile access tower, and when it’s not
  • Carrying out pre-use checks and post-assembly inspections on mobile access towers
  • Assembling and dismantling a mobile access tower using 3T and AGR 
  • Good practices for the safe use of mobile access towers
  • Accessing a platform safely
  • Moving a mobile access tower
  • The components used in a mobile access tower
  • Identifying hazards in the work environment
  • Avoiding personal health hazards
Description:
When and where? Courses can be arranged on request for large groups, or delegates can join a prearranged course if there are fewer numbers. Please contact us to request a date. We ask all delegates to arrive at 8:00am on the course date so that the training can start on time. Most of our training is delivered at our City Depot in Canning Town, a few minutes walk from Star Lane DLR station. The full address and contact information are available here. However training is also available at our other depots based in Croydon and Wembley, or we can delivery training at your place of work, please contact us for further details. On-site training course requirements We can offer this course at your place of work if it is in the London area. For this option the venue must be large enough to accommodate all of the delegates with the maximum being 12 people. The venue must also be clean, warm and dry, PASMA courses require an space large enough to to erect a tower. Towers can be hired for the event. Be aware that if these requirements are not met, we may be unable to offer the training course and you will be liable for the full cost. Duration This course is delivered over 1 day. How many people? We can accommodate up to 12 people on each course. What do I need to bring? Each delegate will need to wear steel-capped boots, gloves, a high-viz jacket or vest and a hard hat. This equipment is available to buy from us on the day, but we cannot guarantee that the correct size will be in stock. How is it assessed? The course is assessed by:
  • Theory assessment which is multiple choice with a 80% pass mark.
  • Practical assessment - all delegates will take part in erecting a tower.
The training instructor will provide an electronic or printed copy of the course notes for future reference. On successfully completing this course, delegates will receive a PASMA Photo Card and Certificate. How much does it cost? Prices vary depending on the number of delegates, get in touch to receive a quote. Get in touch and booking details You can receive further information and a quote by completing the form under the ‘Book this course’ tab, or by emailing us at training@thehireman.co.uk or call 020 7232 5640
Categories: Training

It easily lifts the post and its concrete foundations out of the ground using a hydraulic hand pump, and can then be used to wheel away once removed. The ideal machine for landscapers and fencing contractors. Key features:

  • Extract concrete footings up to 600 mm in diameter
  • Claw attachment for easy removal of broken or rotten posts

Name: Water Powered Dust Suppressor
Description:
A water atomiser, powered simply by connecting to a pressure washer, which emits a fine mist to control dust and odour in demolition and construction works. If used with a bowser or waterbutt, the portion (60%) of water which powers the fan can be recycled. To facilitate movement around site, the unit can be connected to a static pressure washer with up to 75m of hose or attached to one of our bowser pressure washers, and towed around larger areas. Key features:
  • Spray range of 15 m
  • Can be mounted to Bowser Pressure Washer (04/255)

High-capacity, self-propelled Snorkel S3226E electric scissor lift that is designed for on-slab indoor applications. Its narrow width and compact footprint make it great for tight spaces, and the guardrails fold down, enabling it to fit through standard-height doorways. Powered by a bank of heavy-duty deep-cycle batteries, it offers almost silent operation and has enough power for a full day’s work before needing to be recharged. Key features:

Designed for efficiency and safety, it's permanent magnetic base ensures a secure hold, with increased adhesion at the start of each drill for maximum stability. Cordless and compact, this magnetic drill offers exceptional portability without compromising power, making it ideal for on-site fabrication, maintenance and installation work. Key features:
  • Portable for on-site use
  • 15% magnet engagement for fine adjustment of magnetic drill before fully engaging the magnet
  • Forward and reverse option make it convenient for tapping
  • 5 variable speeds for each of the 2 mechanical gears, for a total of 10 speed settings suitable for a range of applications
  • Supplied with safety strap

Advanced Guardrail  (AGR) Aluminium Access Tower
Description:
The AGR system is an alternative method of safe tower assembly. The guardrail frames ensure that the correct guardrail height is achieved every time. They also provide collective fall protection before the operator accesses the platform and cannot be removed until the operator descends and removes the platform first.

Key features:

  • Fewer components

  • Faster assembly

  • Improved fall protection

  • Available in single (0.70 m) or double platform width (1.35 m)

  • Locking castors and adjustable legs (base plates available on request)

  • Toeboards supplied as standard

  • Allow additional 1.25 m from platform for overall tower height

Name: Makita, Plunge Cut Saw, 165mm c/w TCT blade, 110V
Description:
The Makita plunge saw is a versatile circular saw with a unique ‘plunge’ action, allowing you to safely begin a cut in the middle of a workpiece. Perfect for precise cut-outs in kitchen worktops, as well as ducts and vent openings in panels, it’s one of the most popular tools for plunge saw hire and track saw hire. Key features:
  • Depth stopper for splinter-free cutting
  • Max. cutting depth of 56 mm at 90° / 40 mm at 45° / 38 mm at 48°
  • 1.4 m guide rail available for straight, precise cuts (track saw hire)
  • Integrated dust extraction outlet for safer working
  • Supplied with a general purpose TCT blade (ask about specialist blades)
Q: What is a plunge saw used for? A: A plunge saw is ideal for making clean cut-outs in kitchen worktops, panels, ducts, and vents. Its plunge action allows you to start cutting anywhere on the surface. Q: Can I hire a plunge saw with a guide rail? A: Yes, our track saw hire option includes a 1.4 m guide rail, perfect for long, accurate cuts in sheet materials. Q: Does the Makita plunge saw include dust control? A: The saw features an integrated dust extraction outlet to help maintain a cleaner and safer working environment.

Name: GRP Tower
Description:
Our glass-reinforced plastic (GRP) towers are the safest option for working at height in high-risk (zone 1) environments. For example, near live electricity, in explosive atmospheres, and in ‘clean’ environments such as in food processing or technical manufacturing. The glass fibre frames are strong, electrically insulating, chemically resistant, and are less prone to harbouring bacteria.

Key features:
  • Non-conductive/corrosive/oxidising
  • Double or single width slip-resistant platforms
  • Adjustable legs, castors, toeboard and stabilisers supplied as standard
Please Note:
  • Tower prices are calculated on their overall height. Platform heights are 2m lower than the overall height
  • Maximum Safe Working Load: structure 720kg (less total tower weight)/platform 225kg
  • 8.7m platform height and above for internal use only

Name: SafeStand 500 Access Platform System
Description:
The SafeStand Access and Working Platform system overcomes many of the limitations associated with traditional scaffold systems and trestle-and-board setups. Comprising of interlocking components, it is easy to assemble, disassemble, and reconfigure to suit various lengths and configurations. With integrated guardrails and toeboards, it provides a safe and sturdy platform, ideal for constructing walls or performing maintenance on single-story buildings. Key features:
  • Loads up to 1000kg per stand
  • Two trained operators can build a 12m run in less than 10 minutes
  • Three different platform height systems are available from 500mm to 2210mm
  • Additional modules available include: Gate systems, stair modules and Hoddi hoist brackets
  • Complies with Working at Height Regulations 2005

Name: 500l Concrete Column Skip
Description:
These versatile and robust tremie skips are used in conjunction with a crane to move and pour concrete into formwork on site. Designed to lay horizontally on the ground so that they can be filled from a concrete truck, the bale arm then returns the skip to a vertical position when lifted. The delivery hose enables precise direction of flowing concrete, and the spring retractor automatically closes the discharge gate when pouring is finished. Key features:
  • 3 m of reinforced rubber discharge hose
  • Additional gate closing pulley

Name: HDPE Fusion Welder

Name: Multi-Gas Monitor
Description:
This personal multi-gas monitor keeps operatives safe by detecting the most common gas hazards. Small enough to be unobtrusive when worn in confined spaces, it has audible and visual alarms for alerting the user in the harshest of conditions. The ‘TWA Resume’ feature calculates operator exposure over the course of the shift, regardless of the unit being turned off during travel or breaks. Single button operation is intuitive and possible even when wearing gloves. Key features:
  • Detects carbon monoxide, hydrogen sulphide, flammable gases and oxygen depletion
  • Can log up to 130 hours of data at 10-second intervals
  • Impact resistant up to a 4 m drop
  • Visual ‘traffic light’ warning LEDs with 95 dB(A) alarm
  • IP65 total dust and water jet protection

Name: Strongboy For Acrow Prop
Description:
The Strongboy prop is a robust masonry wall support attachment designed to be used with a standard acrow prop. Engineered to provide safe and reliable offset support, it allows builders to work beneath supported walls without risk of collapse. With a strong strongboy prop capacity, it’s the go-to tool when creating larger openings in brick or blockwork to fit lintels, RSJs, or steel beams. Key features:
  • Heavy-duty design for structural wall support
  • Attaches easily to standard acrow props
  • Enables installation of new lintels, beams, and RSJs
  • Allows safe working below supported walls
  • Cost-effective option for short-term strongboy hire
Q: What is a strongboy prop used for? A: A strongboy prop is used with an acrow prop to support masonry walls during alterations, such as creating doorways or fitting steel beams. Q: What is the strongboy prop capacity? A: The strongboy prop capacity is typically rated for heavy-duty wall support, depending on the acrow prop size and positioning. It is suitable for most residential and commercial structural work. Q: How does an acro strongboy work? A: An acro strongboy slots onto the top of an acrow prop, creating an offset support system that transfers load safely while you work beneath the wall.
Categories: Hire, Hire > Safety & Security, Hire > Safety & Security > Support Safety
